conclusion: Analyze the graph to determine the acceleration patterns of objects A and B.
The image shows two velocity-time graphs, labeled A and B, both are parabolas with a red tangent line.
Both graphs are parabolas, suggesting acceleration is initially positive and then becomes negative.
The red tangent line indicates the slope, representing velocity at that instant.
For a parabolic velocity-time graph, acceleration is initially positive as velocity increases, then becomes negative.
Both objects exhibit acceleration that first increases and then decreases.
